questions.question: Did …………………………. phone when I was out?
questions.description: We use anybody in questions and negative sentences.

questions.question: Let’s go ………………………….. quiet.
questions.description: We use somewhere in affirmative sentences.

questions.question: I searched for him everywhere but I couldn’t find him …………………………
questions.description: We use anywhere in negative sentences.

questions.question: I feel like eating ………………………… hot.
questions.description: We use something in affirmative clauses.

questions.question: I didn’t do …………………………… yesterday.
questions.description: We use anything in negative clauses.

questions.question: Does …………………….. know where Michael lives?
questions.description: Anyone means the same as anybody.

questions.question: You can borrow ………………………….. book at a time.
questions.description: Any one means any single one.

questions.question: I took ………………………. to repair the car.
questions.description: Some time can mean quite a lot of time.

questions.question: I …………………………… visited them when I was in Mumbai.
questions.description: Sometimes can mean on some occasions.

questions.question: ………………………….. that year, granny had a heart attack.
questions.description: Early means near the beginning of the period of time we are talking about

questions.question: I hope you can finish the work ……………………………..
questions.description: Soon can mean a short time after now.
